```{r}
#| include: false
# Reusable setup chunk for child documents
# This ensures child documents can run independently or as includes

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = FALSE,
  message = FALSE,
  warning = FALSE,
  fig.width = 7,
  fig.asp = 0.618,
  fig.align = "center",
  out.width = "80%"
)

locale <- Sys.setlocale("LC_ALL", locale = "fr_FR")

# Load Quarto-specific libraries (Suggests dependencies)
library(bslib)
library(htmltools)
library(reactable)
library(ggiraph)
library(here)

# Load required packages for data reading and manipulation
library(readr)
library(lubridate)
library(ggplot2)

# Load package functions if not already loaded
if (!isNamespaceLoaded("edouard")) {
  devtools::load_all()
}

# Use params$data_name if provided, otherwise default to example_data
data_name <- if (exists("params") && !is.null(params$data_name)) {
  params$data_name
} else {
  "example_data" # Default to example data when running interactively
}

# Determine CSV file path based on data_name
csv_file <- here("data-raw", paste0(data_name, ".csv"))

# Read and process the CSV data directly
data_raw <- read_csv(
  csv_file,
  col_types = cols(
    date = col_date(format = "%Y-%m-%d"),
    time = col_time(format = "%H:%M"),
    variable = col_character(),
    value = col_double(),
    unit = col_character(),
    notes = col_character()
  ),
  show_col_types = FALSE
)

# Process the data with human-readable enhancements
data <- process_edouard_data(data_raw)

message("Using dataset from CSV: ", csv_file)
```
